title: Physics Education Design Through Making Activities: Integration of Inquiry and Creation

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of secondary-level physics fundamentals (electric circuits, energy conversion, etc.) and teaching profession experience
context.additional_context: Professional development course for in-service teachers, focusing on developing making-based physics pedagogies immediately applicable to classroom settings

learning_goals: Learners can apply electrical circuit principles (e.g., Ohm's Law) to real-world projects through making activities
Learners can develop making project plans utilizing scientific modeling for inquiry-based learning design
Learners can propose physics education improvement strategies through knowledge sharing with peers and maker communities

resources: Low-Cost Making Kits (Resistors, LEDs, Mini Motors, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
